alert.note: Alert for Bowie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 11:31AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Little River, Hempstead, northern Miller, southeastern Sevier, Howard, northwestern Nevada and east central Bowie Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1130 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Albert Pike Recreation Area to near Center Point to Richmond to near New Boston. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Texarkana, Hope, Ashdown, Nashville, New Boston, Prescott, Mineral Springs, Dierks, Nash, Hooks, Red Lick, Emmet, Wilton, Blevins, Perrytown, Tollette, Fulton, Washington, Ogden and Ben Lomond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for southwestern Arkansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...and northeastern Texas.
